HDG.IM.content: [doesn’t respond to Nietzsche, just props hermeneutics of historicity btwn question & its answer]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: [doesn’t respond to Nietzsche, just props hermeneutics of historicity btwn question & its answer]

HDG.BC.content: we hear Greek thinkers, must think about fact that everything has to do w/ us [imperative of hermeneutics of facticity]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: we hear Greek thinkers, must think about fact that everything has to do w/ us [imperative of hermeneutics of facticity]

HDG.WM.content: going beyond beings occurs in essence of Dasein > this going beyond is metaphysics itself—thus, metaphysics belongs to “nature of the human being” > “because the truth of metaphysics dwells in this abyssal ground [hermeneutic circle of Dasein & metaphysics] it stands in closest proximity to the constantly lurking possibility of deepest error” > [but philosophy was born?] the getting under way of metaphysics, the coming to itself of philosophy, to its explicit tasks

HDG.WM.linkedContent: going beyond beings occurs in essence of Dasein > this going beyond is metaphysics itself—thus, metaphysics belongs to “nature of the human being” > “because the truth of metaphysics dwells in this abyssal ground [hermeneutic circle of Dasein & metaphysics] it stands in closest proximity to the constantly lurking possibility of deepest error” > [but philosophy was born?] the getting under way of metaphysics, the coming to itself of philosophy, to its explicit tasks

HDG.QB.content: presencing (“being”) always presencing directed toward human essence, presencing as a call (Geheiss) that calls upon human essence > human essence as such is a hearing, belongs to calling of this call, the approach of presencing > that which is the Same (“being”?) each time: belonging together of call & hearing—“What am I saying? It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]

It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]

HDG.FS.content: how does dialectical movement avoid falling back into domination of finite, in guise of bad infinite? > answer circularity runs into this difficulty w/out resolving it [beyond hermeneutic circle?]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.FS.linkedContent: how does dialectical movement avoid falling back into domination of finite, in guise of bad infinite? > answer circularity runs into this difficulty w/out resolving it [beyond hermeneutic circle?]

HDG.FS.content: Being and Time asks not about a being but about “is,” addresses the question from perspective of meaning (Sinnes) of Being > “meaning of being”: understandable on basis (im Ausgang) of “project region” unfolded by “understanding of being” [hermeneutic circle?] > understanding: standing before, residing before (sich aufhalten vor), holding (halten) oneself at height of what stands before, being strong enough to hold out (auszuhalten)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Being and Time asks not about a being but about “is,” addresses the question from perspective of meaning (Sinnes) of Being > “meaning of being”: understandable on basis (im Ausgang) of “project region” unfolded by “understanding of being” [hermeneutic circle?] > understanding: standing before, residing before (sich aufhalten vor), holding (halten) oneself at height of what stands before, being strong enough to hold out (auszuhalten)

HDG.DL.content: [back to path of question of hermeneutics] hermeneutics als Beiwort to “phenomenology,” means the interpretation itself [not hermeneutics usual meaning] > explaining etymology of hermeneutics will help clarify Heidegger’s intention (Absicht) w/ experiment (Versuch) of phenomenology > Japaner points out Heidegger has now dropped both words [along his path] > not done to deny phenomenology, but to abandon (lassen) my path of thinking to namelessness > which can’t be successful > because public requires rubric (Titel)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: [back to path of question of hermeneutics] hermeneutics als Beiwort to “phenomenology,” means the interpretation itself [not hermeneutics usual meaning] > explaining etymology of hermeneutics will help clarify Heidegger’s intention (Absicht) w/ experiment (Versuch) of phenomenology > Japaner points out Heidegger has now dropped both words [along his path] > not done to deny phenomenology, but to abandon (lassen) my path of thinking to namelessness > which can’t be successful > because public requires rubric (Titel)

HDG.DL.content: explanation (Erläuterung) of hermeneutics may issue (versteht) in a discussion (Erörterung) [Trakl essay] > hermenuein to hermeneus to Hermes (playful thought more compelling than rigor of sense): divine messenger, brings message of destiny (Botschaft des Geschickes) > hermeneuein: explanation that brings tidings (Kunde), can listen to a message > Plato’s Ion: poets “are interpreters (hermenes) of gods” > hermeneutics not just interpretation but the bearing (das Bringen) of message/tidings

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.DL.linkedContent: explanation (Erläuterung) of hermeneutics may issue (versteht) in a discussion (Erörterung) [Trakl essay] > hermenuein to hermeneus to Hermes (playful thought more compelling than rigor of sense): divine messenger, brings message of destiny (Botschaft des Geschickes) > hermeneuein: explanation that brings tidings (Kunde), can listen to a message > Plato’s Ion: poets “are interpreters (hermenes) of gods” > hermeneutics not just interpretation but the bearing (das Bringen) of message/tidings

HDG.DL.content: language defines (bestimmt) the hermeneutic relation: go right on releasing (entlassen) into open whatever might be said (not a non-committal drifting away)

HDG.DL.content: Heidegger associates phenomenological experience (Erlebnis) w/ “consciousness,” subject/object, refers life back to “I” > Heidegger tried to leave this experience behind in hermeneutic relation of two-fold [Heidegger affirms Erfahrung over Erlebnis?], but “nobody can in just one single leap take distance from the predominant circle of ideas,” especially re: well-worn tracks (langem eingefahrenen Bahnen)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: see Section 34 in Being and Time, see more clearly why hermeneutics & language belong together

HDG.DL.content: is the dialogue from out of the nature of language? mustn’t it first enter into a hearing that at once (sogleich) reaches (einzulassen) essence of language? > Heidegger once called this strange relation hermeneutic circle, exists wherever relation of message & message-bearer prevails (waltet) > message-bearer must come from message, but also must have gone toward it [affirm man’s habit, attention to Being, etc.] > but Heidegger will abandon circle, talk of it is always superficial p. 52 reach a corresponding saying of language [rather than speak about hermeneutic circle]

HDG.LP.content: apartness is active (west) as pure spirit, radiance of blue, kindles (entflammt) a stiller childhood into the gold of 1st beginning > Elis turns his golden countenance toward this earliness, his Gegenblick keeps/guards (wahrt) nocturnal flame of spirit of apartness [what hermeneutic circle names superficially, attention]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: apartness is active (west) as pure spirit, radiance of blue, kindles (entflammt) a stiller childhood into the gold of 1st beginning > Elis turns his golden countenance toward this earliness, his Gegenblick keeps/guards (wahrt) nocturnal flame of spirit of apartness [what hermeneutic circle names superficially, attention]

HDG.EC.content: we abandon (verlassen) ourselves in waiting, waiting is a footbridge (Steg): pure waiting like the echo of pure coming, we are the inlet (Einlass) for the coming [cf. 132] > in waiting we are purely “present” as literally “waiting-toward” [the German is simply: In Warten sind wir reine Gegenwart] [the hermeneutic circle]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: we abandon (verlassen) ourselves in waiting, waiting is a footbridge (Steg): pure waiting like the echo of pure coming, we are the inlet (Einlass) for the coming [cf. 132] > in waiting we are purely “present” as literally “waiting-toward” [the German is simply: In Warten sind wir reine Gegenwart] [the hermeneutic circle]

HDG.OHF.content: hermeneutics [via Theaetetus 209a5]: “announcement and making known (Kundgabe) of the being of a being in relation to…(me)”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: hermeneutics [via Theaetetus 209a5]: “announcement and making known (Kundgabe) of the being of a being in relation to…(me)”

HDG.OHF.content: hermeneutics [via Aristotle]: ermēneia stands for dialektos (conversation), the factical mode of the actualizing (faktische Vollzugsweise) of logos
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: hermeneutics [via Aristotle]: ermēneia stands for dialektos (conversation), the factical mode of the actualizing (faktische Vollzugsweise) of logos

HDG.OHF.content: hermeneutics as translation, hermeneutics [via Christian Churches] as commentary (enarratio), as exegesis > [Augustine on hermeneutics of scripture]

motif.name: TRANSLATION / BABEL in TB (BENJAMIN'S "TASK OF THE TRANSLATOR")
motif.title: TRANSLATION / BABEL in TB (BENJAMIN'S "TASK OF THE TRANSLATOR")

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: hermeneutics as translation, hermeneutics [via Christian Churches] as commentary (enarratio), as exegesis > [Augustine on hermeneutics of scripture]

HDG.OHF.content: Schleiermacher reduced (eingeschränkt) comprehensive/living manner of hermeneutics (Augustine) to “art (technique [Kunstlehre]) of understanding,” discipline connected w/ grammar/rhetoric
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Schleiermacher reduced (eingeschränkt) comprehensive/living manner of hermeneutics (Augustine) to “art (technique [Kunstlehre]) of understanding,” discipline connected w/ grammar/rhetoric

HDG.OHF.content: [Dilthey continues Schleiermacher’s reduction] the developments of hermeneutics (Patristic period and Luther) hidden from Dilthey > still, watering-down of Dilthey today can’t come close to his position re: hermeneutics
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [Dilthey continues Schleiermacher’s reduction] the developments of hermeneutics (Patristic period and Luther) hidden from Dilthey > still, watering-down of Dilthey today can’t come close to his position re: hermeneutics

HDG.OHF.content: for Heidegger, hermeneutics (in connection [Anschluss] w/ its original meaning): definite unity in the actualizing (bestimmte Einheit des Vollzugs) of ermēneuein (communication), i.e. of the interpreting (Auslegens) of facticity: encountering, seeing, concept bringing

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: for Heidegger, hermeneutics (in connection [Anschluss] w/ its original meaning): definite unity in the actualizing (bestimmte Einheit des Vollzugs) of ermēneuein (communication), i.e. of the interpreting (Auslegens) of facticity: encountering, seeing, concept bringing

HDG.OHF.content: for Dasein, having-been-interpreted belongs to its being > hermeneutics has task of making Dasein accessible to to this Dasein itself re: its Seinscharakter, communicating Dasein w/ itself > hermeneutics develops for Dasein a possibility of its becoming/being for itself in manner of understanding itself
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: for Dasein, having-been-interpreted belongs to its being > hermeneutics has task of making Dasein accessible to to this Dasein itself re: its Seinscharakter, communicating Dasein w/ itself > hermeneutics develops for Dasein a possibility of its becoming/being for itself in manner of understanding itself

HDG.OHF.content: hermenutics: wakefulness (Wachsein) of Dasein for itself (not conventional understanding) > interpreting is a being, a distinctive how of character of being of facticity, that belongs to factical life itself (facticity not the object of hermeneutics) > chance that hermeneutics will go wrong belongs to its ownmost being

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: hermenutics: wakefulness (Wachsein) of Dasein for itself (not conventional understanding) > interpreting is a being, a distinctive how of character of being of facticity, that belongs to factical life itself (facticity not the object of hermeneutics) > chance that hermeneutics will go wrong belongs to its ownmost being

HDG.OHF.content: [insidious logic] forehaving of interpretation, that it can’t be present as thematic object clear sign (Anzeichen) of its Seinscharakters, constitutive of interpretation, shares in character of Dasein’s being: Möglichsein (being-possible), modifies itself out of the situation to which the hermeneutic question is operating (Vorhabe not arbitrary/acc. whim)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [insidious logic] forehaving of interpretation, that it can’t be present as thematic object clear sign (Anzeichen) of its Seinscharakters, constitutive of interpretation, shares in character of Dasein’s being: Möglichsein (being-possible), modifies itself out of the situation to which the hermeneutic question is operating (Vorhabe not arbitrary/acc. whim)

HDG.OHF.content: Dasein as the Unterwegs (being-on-the-way) of itself to itself [esoteric/exoteric] > revealed in this kind of being belonging to hermeneutics: the anticipatory leap forward and running in advance (Vorsprung) can/should be undertaken [de facto, de jure] > Vorsprung doesn’t posit (setzen) an end, but gives it free play (freigeben), puts on the way, discloses, holding fast to being-possible
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Dasein as the Unterwegs (being-on-the-way) of itself to itself [esoteric/exoteric] > revealed in this kind of being belonging to hermeneutics: the anticipatory leap forward and running in advance (Vorsprung) can/should be undertaken [de facto, de jure] > Vorsprung doesn’t posit (setzen) an end, but gives it free play (freigeben), puts on the way, discloses, holding fast to being-possible

HDG.OHF.content: scope (Umkreis) of factical understanding can’t be calculated, worked-out in advance (nicht im vorhinein und nie auszurechnen) > hermeneutics engages itself, brings itself into play (einsetzt)—from there understanding is possible
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: scope (Umkreis) of factical understanding can’t be calculated, worked-out in advance (nicht im vorhinein und nie auszurechnen) > hermeneutics engages itself, brings itself into play (einsetzt)—from there understanding is possible

HDG.OHF.content: hermeneutics meant to achieve an existential knowing, i.e., a being (ein Sein) > Sie spricht aus der Ausgelegtheit und für sie [language speaks]

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: hermeneutics meant to achieve an existential knowing, i.e., a being (ein Sein) > Sie spricht aus der Ausgelegtheit und für sie [language speaks]

HDG.OHF.content: all talking about hermeneutics misunderstands it, the wakefulness for facticity must temporalize/unfold “there” > hermeneutics [Heidegger admits to making a personal statement] not philosophy at all, something preliminary (Vorläufiges), has its own explanation (Bewandtnis) for being: what’s at issue in it, not to be finished quickly, rather to hold out in it as long as possible (möglichste lange darin auszuhalten) [slow down] > we’ve become so weak-kneed, pithless, can’t hold out in asking a qustion

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: all talking about hermeneutics misunderstands it, the wakefulness for facticity must temporalize/unfold “there” > hermeneutics [Heidegger admits to making a personal statement] not philosophy at all, something preliminary (Vorläufiges), has its own explanation (Bewandtnis) for being: what’s at issue in it, not to be finished quickly, rather to hold out in it as long as possible (möglichste lange darin auszuhalten) [slow down] > we’ve become so weak-kneed, pithless, can’t hold out in asking a qustion

HDG.OHF.content: self-world & culture not accidental misunderstandings of today, constantly there as analysis travels its proper path (eigentlichen Weg) > hermeneutics must constantly struggle against these 2 possible sidetracks
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: self-world & culture not accidental misunderstandings of today, constantly there as analysis travels its proper path (eigentlichen Weg) > hermeneutics must constantly struggle against these 2 possible sidetracks

HDG.OHF.content: two modes of Dasein of today (Dasein im Heute) (discourse about Dasein) [initial givens of today, closest to us? (Zunächst des Heute)] (: 1) historical consciousness 2) philosophy > modes of interpreting, modes of Dasein’s having-itself in a definite manner, must interrogate these modes to interrogate Dasein of today, to subject the today to a destruction > genuine question of hermeneutics: what Seinscharakter of Dasein shows up (zeigt sich) [cf. Sage as showing] in these modes of having-itself (Sichselbstshabens)?

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: two modes of Dasein of today (Dasein im Heute) (discourse about Dasein) [initial givens of today, closest to us? (Zunächst des Heute)] (: 1) historical consciousness 2) philosophy > modes of interpreting, modes of Dasein’s having-itself in a definite manner, must interrogate these modes to interrogate Dasein of today, to subject the today to a destruction > genuine question of hermeneutics: what Seinscharakter of Dasein shows up (zeigt sich) [cf. Sage as showing] in these modes of having-itself (Sichselbstshabens)?

HDG.OHF.content: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis

HDG.OHF.content: categories are haphazardly employed (from disparate sources) to characterize the basis (Boden) from out of which classifying begins to run its course (seinen Gang nimmt) > “that the Ausgangsverhalten is unworried (Unbekümmertheit) [since worry is there in opening to phenomenological hermeneutics] about its own concrete and precise clarification when the classifying and filing away is being done” “is only a symptom of the fact that its objects are ‘only’ material for a typology and system of classification” > idea of knowledge pursued (angestrebte) here, already sketched out in advance (schon vorgezeichnet) [goes on to describe static system, structuralism even]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: categories are haphazardly employed (from disparate sources) to characterize the basis (Boden) from out of which classifying begins to run its course (seinen Gang nimmt) > “that the Ausgangsverhalten is unworried (Unbekümmertheit) [since worry is there in opening to phenomenological hermeneutics] about its own concrete and precise clarification when the classifying and filing away is being done” “is only a symptom of the fact that its objects are ‘only’ material for a typology and system of classification” > idea of knowledge pursued (angestrebte) here, already sketched out in advance (schon vorgezeichnet) [goes on to describe static system, structuralism even]

HDG.OHF.content: as-what & How of the world’s being-encountered (Begegnens) lie in significance (Bedeutsamkeit), significance not a category of things but the categorial dimension of being-there > being of world & human life both designated by term Dasein > on basis of factical spatiality we can define ontological meaning of being “in” the environs (Umhaften) of world > “being” that encounters world as Weltdasein, characterized by caring, fundamental mode of being, it “is” its world, the very world it has encountered [hermeneutic circle]

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: as-what & How of the world’s being-encountered (Begegnens) lie in significance (Bedeutsamkeit), significance not a category of things but the categorial dimension of being-there > being of world & human life both designated by term Dasein > on basis of factical spatiality we can define ontological meaning of being “in” the environs (Umhaften) of world > “being” that encounters world as Weltdasein, characterized by caring, fundamental mode of being, it “is” its world, the very world it has encountered [hermeneutic circle]

HDG.OHF.content: das Daseiende begegnet im Wie des Besorgtseins, d. h. im Da, das in ein Besorgen gestellt ist [hermeneutic circle?] > the being-there encountered has its own temporality, as cared for in a wider sense [?] > we are concerned for what is not yet, what is approaching: kairological moments of being-there [ek-stasis]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: das Daseiende begegnet im Wie des Besorgtseins, d. h. im Da, das in ein Besorgen gestellt ist [hermeneutic circle?] > the being-there encountered has its own temporality, as cared for in a wider sense [?] > we are concerned for what is not yet, what is approaching: kairological moments of being-there [ek-stasis]

HDG.OHF.content: hermeneutics is destruction! [cf. p. 82 destruction!]
